summary: This bill, the Abolish TSA Act of 2025, aims to eliminate the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) three years after enactment. It mandates the Secretary of Homeland Security, in consultation with the Secretary of Transportation, to create a reorganization plan. The plan involves establishing an Office of Aviation Security Oversight within the Federal Aviation Administration, transferring aviation security activities to private companies, and transferring relevant surface transportation functions to the Department of Transportation. The bill also includes provisions for congressional review of the reorganization plan and regular reporting on progress.
